summary: Like I’m still salty at Marvel for making us wait ten years to get Black Panther when that movie should have come before Ant-Man...
body: Like I’m still salty at Marvel for making us wait ten years to get Black Panther when that movie should have come before Ant-Man and Dr. Strange and then we had to wait 11 years to finally get a movie featuring a female hero. There is also the fact that they haven’t had the best track record with how they write female characters. Like Black Widow and Scarlett Witch were ruined thanks to Whedon and they haven’t been able to fix them so I’m like super wary about Captain Marvel.

reblog.comment: Like I’m still salty at Marvel for making us wait ten years to get Black Panther when that movie should have come before Ant-Man and Dr. Strange and then we had to wait 11 years to finally get a movie featuring a female hero. There is also the fact that they haven’t had the best track record with how they write female characters. Like Black Widow and Scarlett Witch were ruined thanks to Whedon and they haven’t been able to fix them so I’m like super wary about Captain Marvel.

There is also the fact that they haven’t had the best track record with how they write female characters. Like Black Widow and Scarlett Witch were ruined thanks to Whedon and they haven’t been able to fix them so I’m like super wary about Captain Marvel.
trail.content: Like I’m still salty at Marvel for making us wait ten years to get Black Panther when that movie should have come before Ant-Man and Dr. Strange and then we had to wait 11 years to finally get a movie featuring a female hero. There is also the fact that they haven’t had the best track record with how they write female characters. Like Black Widow and Scarlett Witch were ruined thanks to Whedon and they haven’t been able to fix them so I’m like super wary about Captain Marvel.

summary: 'Captain Marvel' Is Already Being Review Bombed on Rotten Tomatoes
title: 'Captain Marvel' Is Already Being Review Bombed on Rotten Tomatoes
description:
A quick look at the audience reviews page for Captain Marvel over on Rotten Tomatoes has been flooded with negative, angry “reviews” of the film and while there are some genuine comments noting excitement for the film, most have an unsettling common theme: anger about Captain Marvel being centered around a female hero.

A disproportionate number of comments on the review page cite issues with a perception that Captain Marvel is “sexist” for a variety of reasons including but not limited to the gender of primary hero, star Brie Larson’s backing of a campaign to send under privileged girls to see Captain Marvel, and generally a number of trolls complaining that the film is a “social justice warrior” or “SJW” film. Some have even gone so far as to lodge the same complaints about Captain Marvel – which, again, won’t hit theaters for another few weeks and first reactions to the film aren’t set to debut until tomorrow – as a certain subset of “fans” did about Star Wars: The Last Jedi.

Sadly, this isn’t the first time a swath of “fans” have attempted to sabotage a new Marvel film. Last February there was an organized effort by disgruntled fans to attack Black Panther with false negative reviews. While those “fans” claimed that their efforts were essentially revenge for poor reviews of Justice League and anger over Star Wars: The Last Jedi, many of the attacks cited complaints about Black Panther being centered around a black superhero. Now, with the false reviews of Captain Marvel also attacking the concept of diversity, be it gender or race-related – it feels a bit like a pattern.

summary: The trolls have emerged from their basements. The review bombing for Capt. Marvel started on Rotten Tomatoes. (e.g. they are...
body:
The trolls have emerged from their basements. The review bombing for Capt. Marvel started on Rotten Tomatoes. (e.g. they are making fake accounts and rallying ppl to mark the movie as “not interested”, since they can’t post actual reviews yet). So don’t be shocked about the low percentage on “Want to See”.

I’d like to say I’m shocked that this is happening again, but I am really-really not.

If you use RT and wanna click “want to see”, feel free. If you want to spend a few minutes to flag up the really aggressive/violent comments as “offensive”, you can also do that. I did it for the really disgusting ones, ugh.

These are the same assholes that tried to “sabotage” Black Panther and The Last Jedi with their protests, fake posts about attacks, and review bombs etc, but they can only ever influence user ratings, which has never really mattered that much. And you can see by the billion+ dollars both movies earned how much these trolls’ don’t matter in the grand scheme of things, so don’t let them dishearten you.

If you’re looking forward to the real early reaction to Captain Marvel, critics will be able to share their first impressions on Twitter tonight, so watch out for that #CaptainMarvel tag.

Higher, Further, Faster, baby!

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

blog.name: lookclosernow
blog.title: We Live In A Beautiful World
blog.description: I'm twenty years old. Call it boredom.

body:
Captain, my captain…

Captain Marvel

Don’t read if you’re not interested it’s just my opinion. I just wonder if someone agrees. That’s it, guys…

About YouTube: I don’t know why it recommends me so many video against Brie and the movie itself. Well, I ignore it it’s just annoying.

About Brie Larson: I like her in the Room (2015), I think she made a great job there. And she had cute relationships with that boy who played her son. Scandals around her new movie just annoy me. As I said it once people like talking I don’t know what’s the truth what’s not. Everyone can intorpretate words or parts of interview the way he wants. And we see what we wanna see. So, I don’t want to spend my time on videos about 20 minuets based on hate or whatever. Because I just want to see the movie that’s it.

About Capital Marvel: I don’t watch or read her interviews about Captain Marvel because again I don’t care, I’ll still go to watch with movie to know her role in Endgame. I don’t expect anything I just go to see MCU movie.

About actress’ body: OMG, I don’t like that people say that she isn’t trained enough because of the way her body looks. It’s really rude sometimes and disgusting. She’s not gonna do flips like Tom Holland so there is nothing wrong about it and so on. For me she looks like fighter that’s it.

About female characters: I’m not crazy about the fact that Marvel makes a movie about female character. I don’t know am I the one who thinks that there were movies lots of movies about strong and interesting women before. I really like some characters whom everyone considers a bad one just because they can’t see deeper. If we talk about comic book characters I like Wonder Woman and Jessica Jones. To be honest the difference between DC and Marvel for me personally that DC has female characters I wanna see in solo (like as I said Diana) but I’m not really interested to see that about Marvel girls. Maybe about Gwen?

About feminism: If we talk about that side of movies Wonder Woman was good also because they didn’t make men weak and stupid (like in Brave heart) to show how cool and strong girls can be.

P.S. Same for me was in The first Avenger.
